newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: WMC says miner dies in Kambalda blast.
newsitem.headline: WMC says miner dies in Kambalda blast.

text.p: Australian mining house WMC Ltd said it was investigating the death of a contract miner in a blast at its Kambalda nickel mine in Western Australia on Sunday.
The man was driving a vehicle down the main decline of the underground mine when a charge laid against the end of the decline suddenly exploded, Kambalda police told Reuters.
The 47-year-old man was hit by flying rock, Sergeant Allan Rice said by telephone. Three other men in the vehicle were injured, none of them seriously, Rice said.
A WMC spokeswoman was unable to say immediately if the explosion would have an impact on mine output.
The mine produced 119,105 tonnes of nickel concentrate in the half year ended December 31.
